channel.title: Personal Pannai Guide
channel.description: Recent content on Personal Pannai Guide

item.title: Crops
item.description:
Crops Module#

Track your crops from planting to harvest and beyond. Manage crop stages, monitor growth progress, and record all related activities throughout each season.

Key Features#

Crop Types#

Specify the crop type to automatically classify as annual or perennial. This determines how the crop lifecycle and field associations are managed.

Stage Tracking#

Track your crop through 7 stages: Preparation, Seeding, Growing, Fruiting, Harvesting, Post-Harvest, and Sold.

Season Management#

Create seasons to organize activities by crop cycle. For perennial crops, new seasons are prompted automatically when the crop is marked as sold.

item.title: Income
item.description:
Income Action#

Record all revenue and sales from your farming activities.

Purpose#

Track money earned from selling crops, livestock products, milk, eggs, or animals.

Key Features#

  • Record sale amounts and dates
  • Track buyer information
  • Link sales to contacts for transaction tracking
  • Monitor quantities sold
  • Calculate total earnings per module

Available In#

  • Crops
  • Livestock

Contact Integration#

Select a buyer contact when recording income to build a transaction history with that contact. Sales linked to contacts appear in the contact detail screen, helping you track your biggest buyers and total sales to each.

item.title: Expenses
item.description:
Expenses Action#

Track all costs and expenditures related to your farming activities.

Purpose#

Monitor spending on inputs, labor, equipment, maintenance, and other operational costs.

Key Features#

  • Categorize expenses by type
  • Record payment details
  • Track vendor information
  • Link machines used for the expense
  • Calculate total costs per module

Available In#

  • Crops
  • Fields
  • Livestock
  • Machines
  • Farms

Tips#

  • Record expenses immediately after purchase to avoid missing entries
  • Take photos of receipts and attach them using Documents
  • Categorize expenses consistently for better reporting
  • Select the tractor/implement used to build machine usage history

Best Practices#

  • Keep all receipts and attach them digitally
  • Record labor costs including casual workers
  • Track both cash and credit purchases
  • Link machines to expenses for usage tracking

item.title: Fields
item.description:
Fields Module#

Manage your agricultural fields and track their usage history. Associate fields with crops, maintain crop rotation records, and store field-specific activities.

Key Features#

Field Registration#

Register all your fields with details like area, location, and soil type.

Crop Association#

Associate fields with any new crop. Fields can be linked to track which areas are being cultivated for each crop.

Crop History#

View the complete history of crops grown on each field. This helps ensure proper crop rotation and plan future plantings.

item.title: Livestock
item.description:
Livestock Module#

Manage your livestock including cattle, poultry, goats, sheep, and pigs. Track animals by purpose, monitor yields, and optionally track dairy cattle individually for detailed production records.

Key Features#

Animal Types#

Support for Cattle, Poultry, Goat, Sheep, Pig, and Others. Each type has specific “Raised For” options.

Purpose Tracking#

Specify why you’re raising the livestock: Dairy, Meat, Breeding, Egg production, or Others.

Individual Tracking#

For dairy cattle, enable individual tracking to monitor each animal separately with detailed yield and health records.

item.title: Tasks
item.description:
Tasks Action#

Schedule and manage farming activities and reminders.

Purpose#

Plan and track activities like irrigation, spraying, harvesting, vaccinations, and maintenance.

Key Features#

  • Create tasks with due dates
  • Set task priorities
  • Mark tasks as complete
  • Get reminders for upcoming activities

Available In#

  • Crops
  • Fields
  • Livestock
  • Machines
  • Farms

Tips#

  • Create tasks for recurring activities like weekly spraying or monthly maintenance
  • Set priorities to focus on urgent farming activities
  • Review pending tasks daily to stay on top of farm work

Best Practices#

  • Plan tasks at the beginning of each week
  • Set realistic due dates based on weather and resources
  • Update task status promptly to track actual vs planned work

item.title: Machines
item.description:
Machines Module#

Track your farm machinery including tractors and implements. Monitor usage patterns, maintenance schedules, and generate reports for service and usage history.

Key Features#

Tractors & Implements#

Machines are categorized into Tractors (powered equipment with engines) and Implements (attachments that connect to tractors).

Usage Tracking#

View usage histories for tractors. Track when and where each machine was used across your farm operations.

Expense Mapping#

Link tractors and implements to expenses on Farms, Fields, Crops, or Livestock. This helps analyze usage patterns and costs.

item.title: Notes
item.description:
Notes Action#

Record observations, comments, and important information.

Purpose#

Document anything noteworthy about your crops, animals, equipment, or fields that doesn’t fit other categories.

Key Features#

  • Free-form text entries
  • Date-stamped records
  • Searchable notes history
  • Link to specific modules

Available In#

  • Crops
  • Fields
  • Livestock
  • Machines
  • Farms

Tips#

  • Record weather observations that affect your farming
  • Document pest or disease sightings immediately
  • Note successful techniques for future reference

Best Practices#

  • Be specific and include relevant details
  • Record observations the same day they occur
  • Use consistent terminology for easy searching later

item.title: Inventory
item.description:
Inventory Module#

Track your farm inventory including seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, fuel, spare parts, and more. Monitor stock levels, usage history, and link inventory items to expenses across all your farm operations.

Key Features#

Stock Management#

Track inventory levels with Add and Use transactions. Monitor current stock and closing balances for all items.

Category Organization#

Organize inventory by categories: Seeds, Fertilizers, Pesticides, Herbicides, Fuel, Spare Parts, Feed, Health products, and Yields.

item.title: Yields
item.description:
Yields Action#

Track harvest quantities and production output.

Purpose#

Record crop harvests, milk production, egg collection, and other measurable outputs.

Key Features#

  • Record quantities harvested
  • Track quality grades
  • Monitor production trends
  • Compare yields across seasons

Available In#

  • Crops
  • Livestock

Tips#

  • Record yields on harvest day for accuracy
  • Include quality information to track premium vs regular produce
  • Compare yields across seasons to identify improvements

Best Practices#

  • Use consistent units of measurement
  • Record both quantity and quality metrics
  • Note any factors that affected the yield (weather, inputs, timing)

item.title: Contacts
item.description:
Contacts Module#

Manage your farm contacts including vendors, buyers, laborers, and other business relationships. Track all transactions with each contact to see purchase and sale history in one place.

Key Features#

Contact Management#

Store and organize contacts for vendors, buyers, and other farm-related relationships.

Transaction Summary#

View all transactions with each contact including inventory purchases and crop/livestock sales.

Purchase Tracking#

When you buy inventory items and select a vendor, the purchase is automatically linked to that contact’s transaction history.

item.title: Documents
item.description:
Documents Action#

Attach files, photos, and documents to your records.

Purpose#

Store receipts, photos, certificates, manuals, and any other relevant files with your farming records.

Key Features#

  • Attach photos and images
  • Store PDF documents
  • Keep receipts digitally
  • Organize files by module

Available In#

  • Crops
  • Fields
  • Livestock
  • Machines
  • Farms

Tips#

  • Take photos of crop growth stages for visual progress tracking
  • Photograph receipts immediately before they fade
  • Store important documents like land papers and insurance policies

Best Practices#

  • Use clear, well-lit photos
  • Name or tag documents descriptively
  • Regularly back up important documents

item.title: Animals
item.description:
Animals Action#

Manage individual animals within your dairy cattle livestock.

Purpose#

Track detailed information about each animal including breed, health, breeding, lineage, and milk production.

Availability#

Important: This action is only available under specific conditions:

  • Module must be Livestock
  • Animal type must be Cattle
  • Raised For must be Dairy
  • Track Individually must be turned ON

If you don’t see this action, check that all conditions above are met in your livestock settings.

item.title: Roles & Team
item.description:
Roles Module#

Manage your farm team with different access levels. Assign roles to control what each team member can see and do in the app.

Key Features#

Role-Based Access#

Three user roles with different permission levels: Owner, Manager, and Worker.

Team Collaboration#

Add team members to your farm and assign appropriate roles based on their responsibilities.

Data Privacy#

Sensitive financial data like income is protected from worker access while allowing them to do their tasks.
